newsitem.title: USA: Laser Vision Centers July case volume up.
newsitem.headline: Laser Vision Centers July case volume up.

text.p: Laser Vision Centers Inc said Wednesday that same U.S. laser surgical case volume for July 1997 increased 342 percent over July 1996.
Same U.S. laser surgical case volume compares the surgical case volume of 19 lasers which were operational in both years.

Laser Vision operates excimer lasers with locations in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Sweden, Finland and Greece. The excimer laser is a device which allows eye surgeons to correct nearsightedness and astigmatism with an outpatient procedure which usually lasts less than one minute.

The company also said that U.S. surgical case volume for the first fiscal quarter ended July 31, 1997, increased 428 percent over the same quarter a year ago and 91 percent over the previous quarter which ended April 30, 1997.
Laser Vision said that during the first quarter, its operations worldwide had already achieved 50 percent of the surgical case volume of the previous fiscal year.
Shares of Laser Vision were trading off 1/16 to 7-5/16.
